class.name: StatisticalReferenceDataset

javadoc.text: * This class gives access to the statistical reference datasets provided by the * NIST (available * here). * Instances of this class can be created by invocation of the{@link StatisticalReferenceDatasetFactory}.
* The name of this dataset.
* The total number of observations (data points).
* The total number of parameters.
* The total number of starting points for the optimizations.
* The values of the predictor.
* The values of the response.
* The starting values. {@code startingValues[j][i]} is the value of the{@code i}-th parameter in the {@code j}-th set of starting values.
* The certified values of the parameters.
* The certified values of the standard deviation of the parameters.
* The certified value of the residual sum of squares.
* The least-squares problem.
* Creates a new instance of this class from the specified data file. The * file must follow the StRD format.
javadoc.throws: IOException if an I/O error occurs

class.method:
<declaration type="ArrayList" name="lines" />
Data columns are in reverse order!!!

javadoc.text: * Returns the name of this dataset.
* Returns the total number of observations (data points).

* Returns a copy of the data arrays. The data is laid out as follows
{@code data[0][i] = x[i]},
{@code data[1][i] = y[i]},
* Returns the x-value of the {@code i}-th data point.
javadoc.param: i the index of the data point

javadoc.text: * Returns the y-value of the {@code i}-th data point.
javadoc.param: i the index of the data point

javadoc.text: * Returns the total number of parameters.
* Returns the certified values of the paramters.
* Returns the certified value of the {@code i}-th parameter.
javadoc.param: i the index of the parameter

javadoc.text: * Reurns the certified values of the standard deviations of the parameters.
javadoc.return: the standard deviations of the parameters

javadoc.text: * Returns the certified value of the standard deviation of the {@code i}-th * parameter.
javadoc.param: i the index of the parameter
javadoc.return: the standard deviation of the parameter

javadoc.text: * Returns the certified value of the residual sum of squares.
* Returns the total number of starting points (initial guesses for the * optimization process).
* Returns the {@code i}-th set of initial values of the parameters.
javadoc.param: i the index of the starting point

javadoc.text: * Returns the least-squares problem corresponding to fitting the model to * the specified data.
* Returns the value of the model for the specified values of the predictor * variable and the parameters.

*
* Parses the specified text lines, and extracts the indices of the first * and last lines of the data defined by the specified {@code key}. This key * must be one of * * *
{@code "Starting Values"}, *
{@code "Certified Values"}, *
{@code "Data"}. * *
* In the NIST data files, the line indices are separated by the keywords{@code "lines"} and {@code "to"}. *
javadoc.param: lines the line of text to be parsed
javadoc.return: an array of two {@code int}s. First value is the index of the * first line, second value is the index of the last line.{@code null} if the line could not be parsed.
